items.question: What is the currency in the One Piece world?
items.answer: The money used in all 5 major oceans are called Berries. According to one fan Q&A the author said one cabbage is worth 250 Berries (orig. Beli).

items.question: What are the five major oceans in the One Piece world?
items.answer: East Blue, West Blue, South Blue, North Blue, and the Grand Line.

items.question: What's up with the guy who looks like a panda who appears in the background in most of the episodes?
items.answer: That's Pandaman, a character who was created by Oda-san himself who was originally created as a new idea character for the Muscle Man series. Pandaman portrays as a "Where's Waldo?" type of character in this anime.

items.question: What are the name of the three types of Devil Fruits?
items.answer: Paramecia Type - The user's body gains inhuman abilities that can either alter the body's appearance entirely or partly.Logia Type - The user is able to tranform into a natural element.Zoan Type - The user is able to transform into a hybrid or physical looking animal.

items.question: Can Zoan Type Users talk to other animals?
items.answer: No, they are only able to transform into a single type of animal, but they don't gain the ability to speak to animals. The only reason why Chopper is able to understand other animals is because he was one to begin with.

items.question: Does Usopp's nose serve as a sniping point to help his aim better?
items.answer: There were times when he made a perfect shot with his head turned away from the slingshot. So no, his nose doesn't serve any purpose for his marksmanship.

items.question: Is there really a Pirate Summit?
items.answer: No, that was a mis-translation in an earlier subtitle version of one episode. It was actually a figure of speech that goes "See you at the top" where "top" can easily be mistaken for "summit" in Japanese.

items.question: Are Mer-people different from Fishmen in this anime?
items.answer: Mer-people are recognized as humans with fish fins for a lower body part.While Fishmen are aquatic humanoids that resemble any kind of fish with gills, and web feet/hands.Eichiro Oda had explained that these two groups of species are different from one another.

items.question: Do the Shichibuchai have to leave their own crew?
items.answer: No, there's no such rule that they have to leave their own crew.

items.question: How's it possible for a powerful pirate to not have a high bounty or no bounty at all.
items.answer: The World Government doesn't have the knowledge to know the true power of each pirate. If a powerful pirate has a low to no bounty, then it means that there were no or few representatives of the government witnessing how dangerous that pirate really is. One example of a low bounty is Chopper, only because he is mistaken as the Straw Hat's pet and is not considered to be an actual crewmember.

items.question: There are so many tall characters in this anime, are all of them giants?
items.answer: No, Giants in this series are at least 10 times bigger than a regular size human.While humans with gigantism are at least 2 times taller than a regular human but are still smaller than a giant.

items.question: What are the "Three Great Powers"?
items.answer: The Marines, The Shichibukai(Seven Warlords of the Sea), & the Yonkou(Four Emperors).

items.question: What is the ranking system of the Marines in this series?
items.answer: From Greatest to Least powerful ranks: Fleet Admiral, Admiral, Vice Admiral, Rear Admiral, Commodore, Captain, Commander, Lieutenant Commander, Lieutenant, Lieutenant Junior Grade, Ensign, Chief Warrent Officer, Master Chief Petty Officer, Chief Petty Officer, Petty Officer, Seaman, Seaman Apprentice, Seaman Recruit & Chore Boy

items.question: Is Makino and Red Haired Shanks related to Luffy?
items.answer: No, there was never such a speculation that all three of them are related with one another. Makino is only Luffy's friend while Shanks is his role model as well as a friend. Nothing more.

items.question: Who is older Usopp or Luffy?
items.answer: Usopp is one month older than Luffy.

items.question: Who is older Zoro or Sanji?
items.answer: Sanji is 8 months older than Zoro.

items.question: How tall are each of the Straw Hat crew members?
items.answer: Monkey D. Luffy: 5'8.5" Roronoa Zoro: 5'11", Nami: 5'7.5", Usopp: 5'9", Sanji: 5'/10.5", Tony Tony Chopper: Between 3 feet-7 feet, Nico Robin: 6'2", Franky: 7'4.5", & Brook: 8'8.5"

items.question: What are Nico Robin & Nami's messurements?
How did Luffy got that scar under his left eye?
items.answer: This was explained in the manga. When Luffy was a kid, he stabbed himself under the eye to prove to Red-Haired Shanks that he was a man. That scene was excluded from the anime.

items.question: How come Nico Robin doesn't show off a funny expression like everyone else does?
items.answer: It's because her attitude is more mature than the other crew members. Plus she's been through a lot of dark moments in her life which results to her not being scared or surprised so easily.

items.question: Was Luffy able to swim before he ate the Gum Gum Fruit?
items.answer: It was said that he was able to swim but wasn't a professional.

items.question: How is it possible for those "Snail Transponders" to work?
items.answer: It is confirmed that the snail transponders have the ability to communicate with each other telepathically, possibly due to an electrical connection. This allows the snail transponders to be able to mimc not only the caller's voice, but also facial expressions to the receiving end.

items.question: What is the name of the island Nami grew up on?
items.answer: Commi Island

items.question: What is the name of the island Usopp was born on?
items.answer: Gecko Island

items.question: What is the name of the island Luffy grew up on?
items.answer: Dawn Island

spoilerItems.question: Does this anime follow the manga's storyline?
spoilerItems.answer: There are tiny changes in certain story arcs as well as an addition of filler episodes that usually take place after a canon story arc. or sometimes within a story arc. Occasionally some of the manga material that is removed is due to the material being inappropriate for the anime. However the plot and flow of the anime remains true to the original manga's plot and story. There are rare moments when a plot element in the anime contradicts the material in the manga but that is usually before the manga chapter to where that plot element becomes known is officially released, so there is no way for the show's production crew to know of this. This consisted of Zoro's ability to cut steel prior to the release of the Alabasta Arc chapters and the limit to Chopper's Rumble Ball consumption prior to the manga chapters of the CP9 saga.

spoilerItems.question: Is there any story elements that are never included in the anime.
spoilerItems.answer: One prime example, is that throughout the manga on the cover pages for the chapters there are what is defined as a mini-arc, that has a character that the Straw Hats encountered before (Usually a defeated villain) having their own adventures. In fact some of these mini-arcs do affect the main story later on. While a few were used in the anime, many were not, which led to some unexplained occurrences in the anime's plot (such as Jango becoming a Marine, or Hatchi opening his takoyaki stand). Several characters that appeared in the later chapters and the anime were originally introduced in the cover arcs such as the Marine's Vice Admiral Garp who was the first character introduced in a mini-arc and was later added to the regular story. One example of the anime's plot contradicting the plot set by a manga mini-arc plot is where in the manga Iron Fist Fullbody was demoted from a Lieutenant to a Sea Man Recruit as a condition to allowing the former Black Cat Pirate Jango to join the Marines. In the anime he was demoted for tarnishing the image of the marines for his humiliation when he was beaten by Sanji. This was mentioned when Fullbody and his men encountered the Straw Hats shortly after Luffy's first bounty is released in a scene that did not occur in the manga.

spoilerItems.question: What year does this series take place?
spoilerItems.answer: It was hinted that it takes place in the year 1522 in one episode. But please note that it's an alternate time period in an another world.There is a point where there is a time skip to two years later making the year: 1524.

spoilerItems.question: Can their be two of the same type of devil fruit?
spoilerItems.answer: No, once a person eats a certain devil fruit, there won't be another of the same fruit again until that person who holds that devil fruit power dies. As revealed in the Punk Hazard arc, when a Devil Fruit user dies their Devil Fruit is reincarnated into a nearby fruit that is the same type of fruit when it was first eaten by the user allowing someone else to inherit those powers when they eat it. The only known character to eat a reincarnated Devil Fruit is Luffy and Ace's childhood friend Sabo, who ate the reincarnated Mera-Mera Fruit, allowing Sabo to inherit Ace's former Devil Fruit powers. Only Blackbeard's fruit has the ability to consume a devil fruit from a dead body which prevents it from being reincarnated.

spoilerItems.question: What would happen if a Devil Fruit user eats another Devil Fruit?
spoilerItems.answer: They'll die, which this fact was revealed in Chapter 385 during the Enies Lobby arc. However, in the manga Chapter 577, Marshall D. Teach (Blackbeard), was able to use an unknown procedure to gain the ability to use the Devil Fruit Powers of Edward Newgate (Whitebeard), though the manga hasn't explained how this happened yet .

spoilerItems.question: How old are each of the members of the Straw Hat Pirates?
spoilerItems.answer: According to Oda-san here is a list of the crew's age group: Monkey D. Luffy: 17, Roronoa Zoro: 19, Nami: 18, Usopp: 17, Sanji: 19, Tony Tony Chopper: 15, Nico Robin: 28, Franky: 34, & Brook: 88When they are reunited two years have past, so: Luffy: 19, Zoro: 21, Nami: 20, Usopp: 19, Sanji: 21, Chopper: 17, Robin: 30, Franky: 36, Brook: 90.

spoilerItems.question: What is up with the characters who have a "D." for a middle initial?
spoilerItems.answer: Any characters that have a "D." for a middle initial are part of the "Will of D" who are part of an ancient clan known as "the Clan of D." Currently, it is not yet known was "D." actually stands for, although a popular theory is that it stands for "Dawn" or "Don." Dawn is for, those part of the Will of D, being able to bring forth the dawn of the new age and liberate the world from suffering. It could also be "Don" because that is the onomatopoeia in Japanese for the beating of the drums, which symbolizes the "drums of liberation" which also marks the beginning of a new world, full of freedom. It is also a sound effect Oda, the author of One Piece, commonly uses throughout the manga.

spoilerItems.question: Was Smoker's information on Daz Bones fate inaccurate?
spoilerItems.answer: After Zoro defeated Daz Bones, Smoker tells Tashigi that Daz Bones was killed after Zoro's final blow. However in the Miss Goldenweek Mini Arc in the manga it was revealed that Daz Bone is alive and was sent to prison along with most of the Baroque Works members. The reason for Smoker to say that Daz Bones was killed is likely that he was misinformed about Daz Bones after the Alabasta incident concluded with the Marine arresting all of the members of the Baroque Works Syndicate.

spoilerItems.question: Name and list the plot holes that were created in the discontinued 4Kids Version.
spoilerItems.answer: When the Warship Island Arc was almost entirely skipped, they remove the episodes that explained why you can't just sail into the Grand Line. This story arc is also an anime filler arc and did not originate in the manga.Laboon Arc. was the second to be excluded which removed the true meeting of Mr. 9 & Miss Wednesday(Vivi), which in the 4Kids Version the Straw Hat Pirates first meet Vivi at Misty Peak(Whiskey Peak). With Laboon excluded, this would of excluded the reason for why Luffy wanted Brook to join the crew. Crocus also excluded was the person who inform the Straw Hat Pirates about the use of Log Pose and the name of the island where One Piece is suppose to be located. Crocus would later end up being revealed to have been a member of Gold Roger's crew.The Little Garden Arc was the last major story arc to be excluded in the 4Kids version. Meaning the encounter of Broggy, Dorry, Mr. 3 & Miss Goldenweek were taken out. Without the encounter of the giants, it wouldn't be possible for Ussop to have convinced Oimo & Kashi that they were deceived by the government about Dorry & Broggy being imprisoned. Without the encounter of Mr. 3 on Little Garden, the Straw Hat Pirates in the 4Kids version act like they never met him or Miss Goldenweek before. Plus it wouldn't be possible for Luffy to know Mr. 3 by the time he encounters him again at Impel Down. The true first appearance of Crocodile was the removal of the scene of Sanji talking to Crocodile on the Snail Transponder under the alias "Mr. Prince" as this also led to the removal of Mr. 3 not knowing about his "conversation" with Crocodile at Little Garden and later Crocodile realizing Mr. Prince (Sanji) was the one who answered Mr. 3's Snail Transponder. Mr. 3's role was rewritten explaining he's been spying on the Straw Hat Pirates since Louge Town(Rouge Town) except the Baroque Works had no knowledge of them until Whiskey Peak. Nami's bug bite was re-written as "Grand Line Fever" when she actually got it from a prehistoric bug on Little Garden. The origin of how she got the fever resulted in utter confusion in the 4Kids version.These plot holes would of effected the 4Kids version if they continued on.
